page.title: 19THE WOODS.
page.content: There are three woods that we go into. Elsey,Park and Dole.In Elsey Wood are rabbits,foxes,deer and many birds.Park Wood is cut in two by the new A15.In all the woods are primroses but sprays drifting from the fields kill many of the flowers.In the Spring there are a lot of bluebells.Dole Wood was donated to the Lincolnshire Nature Trust by Mr K.Stevenson.This is the most used wood in Thurlby.The dead trees are cut down and new trees planted.Bird boxes have been put on some trees.These are some of the animals that you can see; foxes,hares,rabbits,squirrels and deer.The birds you can see are :Wren, Woodpecker,Woodcock,Linnets,Pigeon, Tits,Warblers,Thrushes,Tawny Owl and Blackbirds.In all three woods all the trees are deciduous.Looking after the woods is very important for us and the animals.
